details.purpose: To record data found on examination of the chest by auscultation/listening.
details.use: To be embedded in an openEHR-EHR-OBSERVATION.exam cluster to express findings determined by auscultation of the chest.
details.misuse: Not for use in any other context at present.

items.items: Findings about the first heart sound.
The volume of the first heart sound.
The first heart sound is not heard.
The sound is variable in volume.
No high or low pitched wheezes.
The sound is softer than normal.
The sound is of normal volume.
The heart sound is not split.
The heart sound is split due to physiological changes.
The heart sound is always split.
The variable splitting is not physiological.
The timing of the splitting is physiological but it is more obvious than normal.
Findings about the second heart sound.
Opening sound of the mitral valve.
Group of findings about auscultation of the heart.
Systolic click when the heart contracts.
Rubbing noise during contractions on the pericardium.
Grading of the loudness of a heart murmur.
Site where finding is heard maximally.
Sites where finding is heard in addition to maximal site.
very faint to recognize the murmur even after listening for a while.
faint, but easy to recognize the murmur right after the stethoscope is placed on the chest.
very loud, but you can not hear the murmur, if the stethoscope is away from the chest wall.
the loudest murmur you can hear, even if the stethoscope is off the chest wall.
The timing in relation to the contraction of the heart.
A heart sound in early diastole.
A heart sound in late diastole.
The sound is at about the expected level the first heart sound.
The sound is louder than the first heart sound.
Sound due to a prosthetic heart valve.
Audible rythm similar to a horse galloping due to added heart sounds.
Drawing of the sounds of the heart.
Group of findings about auscultation of the lung.
The timing of the sounds in relation to breathing.
A grouping of discription of one or more added heart sounds.
Specific auscultatory findings related to examination of the heart.
At the final stages of inspiration.
At the late stages of expiration.
Specific auscultatory findings related to examination of the lungs.
The region to which the findings relate.
Findings on auscultation of the chest.
A group of statements about the normality of auscultation.
Statements about the normality of the auscultation.
Detailed clinical description of the findings on auscultation.
Group of findings about auscultation of the bowel.
Group of findings about auscultation of a major blood vessel.
Site where finding is heard maximally.
Bowel sounds are normal in intensity and character.
Specific auscultatory findings related to examination of the bowels.
No bowel sounds can be heard.
Bowel sounds are less than normal.
Bowel sounds are more intense than normal.
High pitched and very frequent bowel sounds can be heard.
The site of the localised findings.
The name of the vessel to which is being listened.
Recording of sounds of a different nature.
